title: Vaah
review: Haveli is really looks history and reminds us many things of past, everything is amazing and we all said Vaah.

title: Marvelous architecture
review: These are some havelis with marvelous architecture. If you love history and architecture, this is a must visit place.

title: Interesting visit
review: The havelis in Jaisalmer were, and some still are, the homes and shops of wealthy merchants. They are intricately carved stone outside and surround a courtyard inside. Lots of souvenirs for sale today. Take a look in one to see how they lived.

title: Manak Chowk and Havelis
review: Manak Chowk and Havelis, such an amazing haveli i have ever seen in Jaisalmer. architecture were marvellous, eye catching, beautiful. i can't describe their beauty in words. worth to visit this place. for history, we have heir a guide.

title: Striking architecture
review: Within this hectically busy fort, Manak Chowk and Havelis are stunning in the detail of their architecture and a pleasure to simply enjoy for the history.

title: Beautiful
review: its so beautiful and lovely they way its a done up ,what fine work of art ,really worth a visit.Theres so much of detailing thats gone into every nook and corner

title: Majesty
review: Must see these pieces of a grand and opulent past. These Havel is are in fantastic condition, it is lovely and cool in the laneways and you can enter without paying. A place to go slow and absorb.

title: Worth a visit
review: Nice to walk around.

title: Some history
review: Good to see and understand the history. Need a good guide who knows the history, which we had. Very interesting to see people actually living in the area

title: Worth it
review: Very much worth visiting. But the owners make their money for maintenance etc by selling products in the inside visit. The facade is quite amazing, inside can be missed.

title: The heart of the That desert.
review: The guide, provided by the Palace on Wheels train company, gave us an invaluable and excellent historical account of this most atmospheric "living museum" from the time the city was founded in 1156 A.D., through it's time as an oasis on the Silk Road and up to date.

title: Intricate carvings
review: This havelis are so very beautiful, they display the intricate designs and carvings, you will want to capture it all in your cameras.

title: Must Visit Sightseeing Place
review: Manek Chowk and Havelis are situated outside the beautiful Jaisalmer fort.This place has many Havelis and chowks.Manak Chowk is flooded with shops offerinf decorative leather works,ethnic silver jewelleries,craft works and antique pieces.

title: Beautiful old city . Quaint streets
review: Lovely, lovely old city in the fort.

title: Amazing Carvings !
review: There are two havelis here. One is old and next to it is the new one. The best part of these havelis are the carvings in the havelis. Jaisalmer will never fail to mesmerise you when it comes to carvings and architecture.

title: Intricately scuplted havelis!
review: The havelis in Jaisalmer are beautiful....they simply astound you with their elegance! Some of them are open for visitors, and I recommend you see at least one.. They also offer pretty views of the town and fort from the roof. They are simply too good to miss out!

title: An architecture jewel!
review: This house has incredible story, each half was built by two architects at the same time, so you can clearly see the differences. It is indeed a jewel! and the owners are great and proud of their ancestral house.

title: Spectacular architecture
review: There are 4, or possibly 5 Havelis here. The combined entrance fees could add up to be quite expensive.  The best feature is the carved stone facade.  You can see that from the street for free

title: amazing architecture not to be missed
review: If you're into old buildings, stone carving and the history of how people lived in this area, please don't miss these havelis. Just a short walk out of the fort through the amazing narrow streets of Jaisalmer, you can certainly fill in an afternoon here.

title: exquisite havelis
review: unfortunately the havelis are not being looked after and are slowly decaying. definitely worth getting a guide to take you around and show you the better havelis.

title: Lots of shops
review: Lots of  craft shops here near the entrance to the fort.

title: OUTSIDE THE JAISALMER FORT.
review: This is also close to Jaisalmer Fort,

title: SO INTERESTING,
review: The Havelis of Jaisalmer are quite simply amazing.  Walk through the lanes of Jaisalmer after visiting the amazing Fort and be enthralled by them all.  A quite unforgettable experience.

title: Busy Streets
review: Outside Fort the place is very busy and all the streets are full of shops.The havelis are good to watch from outside. Shops selling leather items and other handicrafts.

title: Must see.
review: These Havelis are well worth a visit. Most interesting and I would recommend a guide as the history is worth the small amount asked.

title: Busy and nice
review: The place is full of crowd and local people selling ethnic items ranging from footwears to clothes etc.. beautiful place..

title: good place but sirty
review: This is an wonderful piece of history standing there, but not much care has been taken to protect it properly. The outside is very dirty with cowdungs and guides are not very educated to tell the good story of the place. They just made up weird fictional stories.

title: wonderful craftmanship !
review: The fine elegance of the constructions, the balance of the façades and the exquisite quality of the stone carvings make a stroll through the town of Jaisalmer really a highlight.    All the more so because the town is still very lively (and not a museum) and because the wealth is not limited to royals.  Highly recommended !
